analytic.title: A Charge-Based CMOS Parallel Analog Vector Quantizer

abstract.p: We present an analog VLSI chip for parallel analog vector quantiza-tion. The MOSIS 2.0 J..Lm double-poly CMOS Tiny chip contains an array of 16 x 16 charge-based distance estimation cells, implementing a mean absolute difference (MAD) metric operating on a 16-input analog vector field and 16 analog template vectors. The distance cell including dynamic template storage measures 60 x 78 J..Lm 2 â€¢ Additionally, the chip features a winner-take-all (WTA) output circuit of linear complexity , with global positive feedback for fast and decisive settling of a single winner output. Experimental results on the complete 16 x 16 VQ system demonstrate correct operation with 34 dB analog input dynamic range and 3 J..Lsec cycle time at 0.7 mW power dissipation.
